title: Doodlecord
subtitle: A fun and simple instant messaging web app, used to communicate in real-time with friends through peer-to-peer channels

content.heading: Communcation Platform
content.subheading: A fun and simple instant messaging web app, used to communicate in real-time with friends through peer-to-peer channels

body.title: The Chat
content: The chat is very simple, on the left we have information about the current server the user has joined. Listing the channels and online users.

Doodlecord was originally a project developed for my fullstack development class, under the name Group Speak. I decided to reinvent the application and create a more robust chat system. Adding more features and pushing my knowledge of Web Sockets.
I chose to rewrite the application because I wanted to learn more about Web Sockets, and this was a good opportunity to do so.

title: Interviewy
subtitle: Interviewy provides jobseekers an accessible environment where they can practice their interview skills at any time.

body.title: Inspiration
content: An abundance of qualified applicants lose their chance to secure their dream job simply because they are unable to effectively present their knowledge and skills when it comes to the interview. The transformation of interviews into the virtual format due to the Covid-19 pandemic has created many challenges for the applicants, especially students as they have reduced access to in-person resources where they could develop their interview skills.

Interviewy is an Artificial Intelligence based interface that allows users to practice their interview skills by providing them an analysis of their video recorded interview based on their selected interview question. Users can reflect on their confidence levels and covered topics by selecting a specific time-stamp in their report.
The user can enable their camera and practice their facial expression and see themselves live.

This Interface was built using the MERN stack. The backend used the AssemblyAI APIs for monitoring the confidence levels and covered topics as well as getting the sentiment analysis of the user. The frontend utilized react and bootstrap css.

body.title: TEAM
content: I worked on the backend, utilizing Express, Mongoose and the AssemblyAI api to bring this projects backbone together. Very fun!
Reza worked on the backend with Emanuel and learned to use Express and Node.js under 36 hours which was very exciting ,yet challenging
Faizah worked on the frontend using React to create appealing and intuitive UI for our users, and to display the results from the AI analysis. I am very proud of what we accomplished!

title: EMAZON
subtitle: An e-commerce website that allows user's to create, view and buy any product listed on the site.

content.heading: An ECommerce platform built to rival amazon

body.title: CLEAN DESIGN
content: I wanted to build an e-commerce platform using new technologies such as React Redux (for handling data), Tailwind CSS (class based CSS framework), Stripe (for handling payments) and AWS Amplify (server back end). I started this process by using the create-react-app boilerplate, then adding react-router-5.0, tailwindcss, aws-amplify, stripe and redux.
Some unexpected obstacles were Tailwind CSS not styling the way I wanted it to style and Amazon Amplify requiring a lot of research to fully understand and integrate with Stripe.

title: PKGHound
subtitle: Ionic React project built to resemble the popular website product hunt.
